abstract: Some Navajo leaders are considering repealing 2005 tribal law prohibiting same-sex marriage, noting that if Supreme Court does rule in favor of legalization later this year, it will not apply to Navajo's sovereign nation; move is opposed by both Navajo traditionalists and other tribal citizens who feel that issues like drug abuse and depression are more of a priority.
lead_paragraph: At least one presidential contender favors repealing a 2005 tribal law that prohibits same-sex marriage and cannot be reviewed by the Supreme Court.

headline.main: Among the Navajos, a Renewed Debate About Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Among the Navajos, a Renewed Debate About Gay Marriage

snippet: At least one presidential contender favors repealing a 2005 tribal law that prohibits same-sex marriage and cannot be reviewed by the Supreme Court.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
